How does HighFold ensure accurate predic: By enumerating all possible disulfide bridge combinations and creating corresponding matrices.
By using a fixed set of disulfide bridge patterns.
By relying solely on experimental data for disulfide bridge formation.
By excluding disulfide bridges from its predictive model.
What is the primary purpose of HighFold: To predict the structures of cyclic peptides and their complexes with head-to-tail and disulfide bridge constraints.
To develop new experimental methods for synthesizing cyclic peptides.
To enhance the speed of traditional computational approaches for linear peptides.
To create a database of known cyclic peptide structures.
What is the role of the CycPOEM matrix i: To account for the cyclic nature and disulfide bridges in peptides.
To enhance the speed of peptide synthesis.
To visualize the folding process of linear peptides.
To simulate the thermal stability of peptide complexes.
